attributes.action: to properly engage with the electorate, on the government's intentions to allow the creation of animal human hybrids, including the benefits and risks.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Human Tissue and Embryology Bill allows scientists to create a variety of embryos made up of of different species. Public consultations to date have overwhelmingly rejected  this research. It presents the dilemma of what it will actually mean to be 'human'. Dismantling natural evolutionary barriers that prevent inter species fertilization has the potential to dwarf matters such as global warming, nuclear power, overseas conflict etc (important as they are).

Questions remain: a)What are the benefits?  b)Will there be more animal experimentation? c)Why not rely on alternative stem cell research (adult cells) d) Why leave ethical decisions to an unelected quango (HFEA)?  e) Why has the government not been pro-active in its public messaging? 

We need a properly informed public debate now on the benefits,risks and ethics.
